title.native: ダンガンロンパ３-The End of 希望ヶ峰学園-希望編
title.romaji: Danganronpa 3: The End of Kibougamine Gakuen - Kibou-hen
title.english: Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak High School - Hope Arc

description:
The Future Foundation is in shambles after the Final Killing Game and the revelation of the true culprit. As a desperate plot arises from one of the survivors to rid the world of despair once and for all, the remaining Future Foundation members must band together to stop it. Fortunately, they find themselves with help from a group of unlikely allies as they race against the clock to stop their world from being changed.

As a direct continuation of Mirai-hen, Kibou-hen serves as the finale to the Hope's Peak storyline of the Danganronpa series.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kazkodaka/)

A former employee of Spike Chunsoft and the co-founder of Too Kyo Games. He is primarily known for being the creator and scenario writer of the _Danganronpa_ video game series.

Rui Komatsuzaki is best known as the main concept artist of the Danganronpa franchise.

Komatsuzaki was a sculpture graduate before becoming involved with Spike, and Danganronpa was his first experience as a character designer.

(Source: Danganronpa Wiki)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/995498317)

Interested in films and comics from his early childhood on. After graduating high school he went to Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and afterwards started working as animator for [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/). After becoming a freelancer for a short time, he joined Logistics where he worked in the software development section and was responsible for animation work and later developing tools for animation work in games. In 2002 he founded [Team Till Dawn](https://anilist.co/studio/6412/), which was also the beginning of his career as anime director.

His hobbies outside of work include bodybuilding, in which he has gone as far as to take part in competitions

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

**Birthplace:** Los Angeles, California
**Spouse:** Rachel Robinson (2019-)

**Introduction:**
Christopher Bevins, alternatively known as Chris Bevins is an American voice actor, ADR director and script/screenwriter. He is more known for his work as an ADR director at FUNimation Productions in Dallas/Fort Worth, Texas.

**Non-anime roles:**
~!- Dhalsim and Soldier A (David) in "Street Fighter V" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter IV" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter X Tekken" (VG)
- Koga, Brycen and Swimmer in "Pokémon Masters" (VG)
- Legault in "Fire Emblem Heroes" (VG)
- Nadai in "Fist of the North Star: Lost Paradise" (VG)
- Shishiwakamaru in "Yu Yu Hakusho: Dark Tournament" (VG)
- Voice in "FUNimation" (logo bumper)
!~
**Non-anime staff credits:**
~!- Script Adaptation for "Sengoku Basara: Samurai Heroes" (VG)!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/daiki_fukuoka)

**Daiki Fukuoka** is a Japanese director, episode director, production manager and storyboard artist.

__Genres:__ Alternative rock, heavy metal, power metal, progressive metal, J-Rock
__Instruments:__ Guitar, bass, vocals
__Associated acts:__ [X Japan](https://anilist.co/staff/102381), Zilch

**Hideto Matsumoto**, known professionally as **hide**, was a popular Japanese musician. He was primarily known for his work as lead guitarist of the popular heavy metal band X Japan from 1987 to 1997. He was also a successful solo artist and co-founder of the United States based band Zilch. 

He died in May 2, 1998, found hanged with a towel tied to a doorknob in his Tokyo apartment. Although officially ruled a suicide, several of Hide's friends and colleagues stated that they believed the auto-strangulation to have been an accident, among them X Japan co-founder Yoshiki and former X bassist Taiji.
